contents.text: Sydney the Sloth and the Uphill Ride

contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.
contents.text: Do you want to know what's going to happen next?
Sydney the sloth and her family live in a deep green forest in South America. Her house is under big tall trees. After school, she spends her days ssleeping under the trees.

One day, her father, who is a turkey, buys her a shiny blue bike.

"Sydney, you can play outside with your bike," says Pa.

Sydney wants to play outside, but after much thinking, she would rather take a nap in her house.

"I like outside. I want to be outside. But right now I want to be inside and have a nap," says Sydney.

"Oh come on Sydney, let's go outside. It will be fun!" says Pa.

So they did.

"Ride this bicycle," says Pa.
Sydney has never ridden a bike before. She falls off within seconds.

"No sloth is good at balancing themselves, Pa!" says Sydney.

"Don't say that," says Pa. "Let me help you balance the bike," he says.

As Sydney climbs on the bike again, Pa Turkey leaps and sit on the back of the bike.

"Push the pedal and I will balance the bike," says Pa.

Sydney pushes the pedal down. One, two, and three.

"Keep going. You can do it!" says Pa.

Something magical happened. A breeze of cool air hits Sydney's face. Sydney is biking on her new bike!

The kids in the forests cheer for Sydney's successful bike ride.

contents.subtext: Physical activity is any activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath like running, playing in the park, dancing, or swimming.
contents.text: Sydney's parents helped her to be more active. Can you tell a story when your parent or caregiver helped you in a physical activity?
Can you think of a physical activity that you can do together with your parent (or caregiver) next week?
Asking for help from your parent or relatives is a great way to have fun, and learn new activities!

Chapter 2 

 Bike Ride with Friends

contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.
contents.text: Do you want to know what's going to happen with Sydney and her bike?

Since her first successful bike ride, Sydney has been playing outside with the help of her father, Pa Turkey. They go to the grocery store with the bike. They go to the laundry and they even go to the pool. Biking is a lot of fun.

"Why don't you try balancing the bike by yourself while I am away?" says Pa.

The next day, Sydney tries to use the bike by herself. She invites her closest friends to watch her.

She starts to pedal. One. Two. Three.

The breeze starts to hit her face but suddenly she falls to the ground again.

"Sloths are not good at balancing," says Sydney.

"That can't be true!" says Cobby her friend.

"I need my dad to balance the bike. And he is out of town", says Sydney.
"I have an idea!" says Cobbie.
Cobby runs around the jungle to get the stuff he needs. He grabs a bunch of twigs, a bagful of leaves, and two dozen small rocks. Then Cobbie makes something very unbelievable.

Cobby makes wooden turkey wings that looks like Pa Turkey!

"This wooden wings will help you balance your bike," says Cobbie.

Sydney is unsure. The fake turkey looks funny. "Are you sure this is a good idea?"

"Trust me!" says Cobbie as he ties the wooden wings to  Sydney's bike.

Sydney climbs on the bike. She is still feeling unsure about the wooden wings. 

"Imagine that this is Pa Turkey. Now hit the pedals!" yells Cobbie.

Sydney started to push the pedal. One. Two. And three.

"Keep going. You can do it," cheers Cobbie.

And that magical thing happened again. A breeze of cool air hits Sydney's face. Sydney is biking on her new bike! With wooden turkey wings on her back.
Sydney and Cobbie and their friends bike around the forest until it was getting dark and it was time for them to go home.

contents.subtext: Physical activity is any activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath like running, playing on the playground, or playing sports like baseball or soccer.
contents.text: Cobbie supported Sydney to learn how to use a bike. Can you tell a story when you supported your child in being physically active.
You don't have to do physical activities alone. It is always good to get help from other people close to you!
Chapter 3: Forest Charity Race

contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.
contents.text: Do you think Sydney can ride the bike without the wooden wings?

Every year, the residents of the forest have a tradition that is unlike any other forest. They have a charity race.

Animals of all sizes bring their coolest bikes outside for a race to raise money to make the forest safe and clean. The fastest bicyclist is Bob the Rhino with his red bike.

"I want to win this race," says Sydney.

"But this is not a game to win, this is for everyone in the forest to have fun," says Pa Turkey.

"And to give something to the community," says Ma. "I have a surprise for you," says Ma to Pa Turkey.

She brings a new bike for Pa Turkey.

"Now you two can bike together in the race," says Ma.

Sydney and Pa in the charity race together. Sometimes Sydney is ahead of her father. Sometimes, Pa is ahead of Sydney.

Sydney wants to win the race, so she pedals faster and faster. Then something really bad happened.

Sydney's wooden wings fell off her bike and and fell apart.

"There's no way to save this fake turkey! I can't bike anymore!" yells Sydney who is feeling upset.

"And I'm going to lose the race," she says.

"Sydney, you have used the bike for two months. You can bike without the wooden wings," says Pa Turkey.

"No, I can't! Sloths are not good at biking," says Sydney.

"You have been riding that bike all day every day for the last two months. Sloths can be good at biking," says Pa Turkey.

"Let's give it another try," says Pa.

Sydney begins to pedal his bike without the wooden wings. One. Two. Three. And within seconds she is blazing through the forest!

Once she and her father got to the finish line, they hear the news. They came in last.

"We didn't win!" says Sydney.

"But it doesn't matter," says a deep voice behind Sydney's back.

It's Bob the Rhino, the fastest cyclist in the forest.

"Did you bike without your wooden wings today?" he asks.

"Yes I did," Sydney answers.

"That is more important than winning, Sydney," says Bob.

"Winning is fun. But getting better at something is a lot more fun," Bob says.

"And today you learned that you don't need the wooden wings. You can balance all on your own! Now that is something to celebrate!."

The night after the race, Sydney is feeling happy. She did not win the race, but she did get better at something.

And that is the most important thing of all.

contents.contentGroupName: Being Active is Not Always About Winning
contents.subtext: Physical activity is any activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath like doing yoga, jumping rope, or skating.
contents.text: Sydney did not win the race but she did get better in biking. Can you tell a story about a time when you did not win a physical activity game?
Did that make you want to stop playing? Think about what you learned even though you did not win?

Practice makes perfect!

It is more important to try your best at an activity, rather than thinking about winning.
Chapter 4: A Trip to the Hill

contents.subtext: To read the rest of the story, complete a one-day challenge with your family.
contents.text: Do you want to know what's going to happen with Sydney?

The better Sydney gets with her bike, the more places she can explore. Now, she can even bike all the way to riverside to chat with the Crocodiles.

"The crocodiles are very friendly," says Sydney to her Mom.

Sydney bikes to the meadows to race with the sheep.

"Their hair is very thick, and they do run very fast!" says Sydney to her Pa.

She also bikes to the waterfall to sing with the fish.

"They sound like they're singing underwater!" says Sydney.

"Why don't you take your little brother to the hill to sing with the birds?" says Pa Turkey.

"But he doesn't have a bike," protests Sydney.

"You're going to walk your bike to the hill. Then you can use your bike there," says Pa.

"Okay," says Sydney.

The next day, the two sloths walk to the hilly part of their neighborhood.

Sydney is not happy because she wants to ride her bike. Instead, she has to babysit her little brother instead.

"Just play with your kite," says Sydney to her brother.

But something unexpected is about to ruin their day.

A strong wind pushes the two sloths to the ground and whisks the brother's kite away.

"I lost my kite," cries Sydney's brother.

The kite rolls around in the wind. It goes up and down and swirls around. Over and over again. Finally, it lands on a spot that the two sloths can't reach.

It lands on top of a hill. One of the tallest hills in their neighborhood.

"Sydney, help me get my kite back. Can you bike there?" asks Sydney's brother.

"I don't know. Sloths are not good at riding a bicycle," says Sydney before she pauses.
"Sloths may not be good riding bikes, but I always get better at something every time I practice," Sydney whispered.
So she made up her mind. She pedals her bike. One... Two... Three.

And the nice cool breeze hit her face again. Sydney's brother's jaw dropped. His sister can bike very fast unlike any other sloths he has ever seen. She blazes all the way up the hill to get the kite and coasts all the way down.

"Here's your kite. Hold it tight," says Sydney to her brother.

Her brother can't say a word. He is very impressed with his sister.

For Sydney, it doesn't matter if her brother doesn't even say thank you. His smile showed just how proud he was of his sister.

contents.subtext: Physical activity is any activity that makes you sweat or become out of breath like speed walking, riding a bike, or hiking.
contents.text: Sydney is better at bicycling because she practiced a lot. Can you tell a story about a time when practicing makes you better at being physically active?
When you notice that an activity is getting easier, it can mean that you are getting better at it.

You have completed this storybook. Your next story is:

"Leon is Hungry"
